Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
Their arms are made of a special liquid. They use psychic power to control these arms and crush boulders.
Its not very good at flying yet. It watches the dances of its Swanna parents to learn how to move its wings.
Centered around its leader, the flock dances in perfect sync to strengthen its unity.
Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokmon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.
It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokmons nutrients.
There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Pok Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoongusss caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
It gently holds injured and weak Pokmon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
While one alone doesnt have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when Litwick absorbs life-force from people or Pokmon.
Lampent appears at the moment of death and promptly absorbs the spirit as it leaves the body.
The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
This Pokmon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
Because its tusks dont grow back once they break, this Pokmon apparently wont use them unless truly necessary.
This Pokmon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, theres a chance it is sick.
It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokmon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokmon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokmon.
In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, youre in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!
These Pokmon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.
When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately. During such rampages, it can turn a whole town into a mountain of rubble.
Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.
This Pokmon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokmon.
Its always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokmon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.
It cant see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
The two heads do not get along at all. If you dont give each head the same amount of attention, theyll begin fighting out of jealousy.
Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
This Pokmon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.
Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.
When Chespin tenses up just before landing a headbutt, the spikes on its head sharpen to points, piercing the enemys body on contact.
Its protected by a sturdy shell. The shell is also very heavy, which naturally strengthens Quilladins lower body.
When its allies are in trouble, Chesnaught creates a shield with its arms and uses its own body to block attacks.
This Pokmon gets worked up easily. Its body can also overheat, so it uses its ears to dissipate the heat and calm down.
It ignites the twig from its tail and waves the twig around to signal its allies. To indicate danger, it draws circles in the air with the twigs flame.
It leaves burn marks in the ground with the flame at the tip of its wand. Long ago, people used the shapes of these burn marks for divination.
Its happy-go-lucky look is an act intended to fool its enemies. It will suddenly drop the facade and overwhelm its foes with its blinding speed.
It excels at devising battle strategies that make use of the terrain, and it never misses its mark when throwing bubble-covered pebbles.
The movement of air against the long tongue Greninja keeps wrapped around its neck allows it to sense enemies it cant see.
This Pokmon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokmon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
Any poison this Pokmon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. Thats why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
If Rufflet attacks this Pokmon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
The patterns on this Pokmon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from frigid lands.
When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. Its thanks to them that their pride doesnt starve.
This Pokmon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
This Pokmon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
This Pokmon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokmon to traverse the mountain paths.
It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
It keeps its ears covered to prevent the intense psychic power in its body from escaping, but it falls unconscious if this power builds too much.
Though it has enough psychic power to blast away any opponent, Meowstic prefers to support its allies rather than attack.
It protects itself from tough foes by flashing its luminescent spots to discourage them.
Its hypnotic powers are dangerously strong. Anyone who falls under Malamars control loses their memories surrounding the event.
Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
This Pokmon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokmon.
Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
This Pokmon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
Its elegant finishing movesperformed by nimbly leaping around using its wingsare polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
Its small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from peoples homes and charge itself.
It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. Its occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Most of a Goomys body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokmon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
It loves the rain. This mellow Pokmon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
Once it absorbs a keys metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
Legend tells that its green leaves can cure any illness. When plucked, however, the leaves will instantly wither away.
Using its roots, Trevenant connects itself to trees and monitors every corner of its forest. It uses curses to drive intruders away.
They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
This Pokmon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokmon has a cruel disposition.
Silently it glides, streaking toward its targets to get close to them. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
This narcissistic Pokmon is a clean freak. If you dont groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.
It cunningly conceals arrow quills in its wings. It launches these quills with such precision that they can pierce a pebble at over a hundred yards.
If you try too hard to get close to it, it wont open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever fire spews out.
When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
This Pokmon can control balloons made of water. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big balloons.
A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, then briskly bombards its enemies.
To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
Using its beak to strike 16 times per second, it opens holes in even the hardest of trees.
It flies around using a hundred different cries in various ways to declare its territory to others.
The compressed gas in Toucannons beak launches seeds with such force that they can shatter large boulders.
Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
Grubbin normally live underground, but if they get unearthed by Hoothoot, they may be found gathered around electric Pokmon.
Protected by a sturdy shell, Charjabug eats large quantities of fresh and decomposing leaf litter in order to evolve.
Displaying exceptional mobility, it weaves between trees and shoots down bird Pokmon with its electromagnetic beams.
This Pokmon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
The detached pincers of these Pokmon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
This Pokmon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
When it senses the auras of people or Pokmon who are having fun, it will draw close and give them a painful poke with its long proboscis.
Ribombee can sense when people or Pokmon are feeling down, and it will cheer them up with handmade pollen puffs.
This Pokmon is very friendly when its young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
This Pokmon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
This Pokmon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
This Pokmon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud wont dry out even if its exposed to the sun for a long time.
This Pokmon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
Dewpider uses sticky threads to create the water bubble that covers its head, so the bubble very rarely bursts.
A caring Pokmon, Araquanid carries Dewpider around inside its water bubble to protect them as it walks. It protects its food in its bubble too.
Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
By masquerading as a bug Pokmon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokmon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
This Pokmon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
It uses its vine to pick flowers. The flowers that Comfey attaches to itself develop healing properties.
People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokmon of the forest.
This Pokmon battles by throwing hard berries. It wont obey a Trainer who throws Pok Balls without skill.
If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else like a branchin its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokmon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
This Pokmon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
The scale atop its head is useful for both offense and defense. It bravely stands and faces its foes rather than turning tail, even if its foes are strong.
It gets into fistfights so intense that the scales on its arms peel off. Bare arms are a sign of valiance.
It lets its arm hang, and thenquick as a flash swings upward to land its specialty punch and send the opponent flying high into the sky.
The stick Grookey holds has grown harder and more flexible after soaking in the energy that emanates from inside Grookeys body.
It skillfully uses its two sticks not only for drumming out rapid beats but also for pummeling opponents during battle.
Though it has a calm disposition, it wont tolerate those who drum up discord. It strictly disciplines offenders until they learn their lesson.
Once its body has heated up, Scorbunny can use the full extent of its power. Thats why it does warm-up exercises.
Thanks to its soft and fluffy fur, Raboot can easily heat up its fire energy and produce flames with more power.
Although Cinderace loses its cool easily, it will battle flawlessly for a Trainer it trusts.
It gets berries to eat by shooting them down with bullets of water it spurts from its mouth. Its aim is perfect.
It extends its long, slimy tongue at blinding speeds and finishes off its prey with great skill.
It uses special lenses in its eyes to sense things about its opponentslike their body heatthen attacks once it identifies a weak spot.
It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glanceeven if its in the middle of a battle.
This Pokmon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidees eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokmon.
Its said that the reason behind Corvisquires high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokmon.
Corviknight cant serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokmons natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokmon will bite another Chewtles horn, and the two Pokmon will tussle.
Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokmon has an extremely vicious disposition.
On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.
It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apples skin and prevent it from rotting.
It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponents guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.
It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokmon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.
Silicobras neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.
It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.
Cramorant instinctively swallow everything whole. Theyre at their most formidable when theyre struggling to swallow overly large prey.
Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.
It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the waters surface.
It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxels body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.
As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.
The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokmon appears in hotels and houses.
The tea that composes Polteageists body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.
Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokmon prefers environments where no other creatures live.
To this Pokmon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noiseseven if the emotions are happy ones.
Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.
The reason this Pokmon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it cant absorb negative emotions.
Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesnt have confidence in its brawn.
This Pokmon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.
The more sweet aromas it absorbs, the more its body swells. Milcery will deflate when its energy level drops.
Desserts that Alcremie have decorated with their cream have a rich, sweet flavor and bring happiness to all who eat them.
The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
This Pokmon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.
Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.
The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokmons habitat.
On hot days, these Pokmon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
This Pokmon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.
Morpeko eats seeds constantly to keep its hunger at bay. If its hungry for too long, it grows wild and brutish.
Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.
This Pokmon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. Its so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.
Duraludons body is comprised of a special metal thats lightweight and scratch resistant. Its also smooth, as though it was given a mirror finish.
In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokmon in the water for fun.
This Pokmon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.
Dragapult can make its whole body transparent by clearing its mind and focusing. Even the Dreepy in Dragapults horns become invisible.
Parts of its body turned to stone when it evolved thanks to an extremely rare ore found in volcanic areas.
This Pokmon is cloaked in the souls of its comrades who perished during a punishing journey to the river of their birth.
Overqwils poisonous spikes will reflexively react even while Overqwil sleeps, stabbing any moving thing that approaches.
Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokmon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
This Pokmon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
The combination of Crocalors fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokmons head.
The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirges head gained a soul.
This Pokmon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."
These Pokmon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokmon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesnt use it for anything other than foraging.
Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokmons natural enemy.
It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
It has its third set of legs folded up. When its in a tough spot, this Pokmon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
This Pokmon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokmon, but nobody knows for sure.
This Pokmon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidoughs breath induces fermentation in the Pokmons vicinity.
The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokmons body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
This calm Pokmon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokmon.
These Pokmon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
This Pokmon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the preys body.
Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokmon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokmon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokmon is incredibly loyal.
The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
When this Pokmon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokmon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokmon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiffs face.
This Pokmon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
Though usually a mellow Pokmon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokmon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokmon.
It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
These Pokmon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf cant remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
The more sunlight this Pokmon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
This Pokmon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokmon is actually inside the ball.
Flittles toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokmons belly.
It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokmon that eat metal.
This Pokmon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
This intelligent Pokmon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
This Pokmon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokmons chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
This Pokmon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
It is said that this Pokmon was born when an unknown poison Pokmon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylindersnow numbering eightto generate energy.
Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
When attacked, this Pokmon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
When this Pokmon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
It is said that a dog Pokmon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokmon.
Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokmon, this one is most loyal to its master.
This Pokmon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
This Pokmon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
This Pokmon is a glutton, but its bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
This is a small dragon Pokmon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokmon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
When attacked, this Pokmon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. Its a risky move that puts everything on the line.
Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokmon is 10 times stronger than Girafarigs.
This Pokmon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
Sightings of this Pokmon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokmon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokmon.
This Pokmon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
This mysterious Pokmon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
No records exist of this Pokmon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokmons traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
This Pokmon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
It resembles a certain Pokmon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
This Pokmon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
It has some similarities to a Pokmon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.

Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
This Pokmon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokmon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
The grudge of a person punished for writing the kings evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokmon.
This Pokmon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokmon.
It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
It has some similarities to a mad scientists invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.

It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
It resembles a Pokmon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.
It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.

Even after using up all its dark energy, this violent ruffian will keep running riot until its hunger is appeased.
It crossed the sea and drifted ashore in a new land. Surviving in this place led it to take on a unique appearance and gain special powers.
The souls of its comrades cloak its body and propel it effortlessly through even raging rapids.
This Pokmon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokmon, but nobody knows for sure.
The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. Theyll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
This Pokmon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
This Pokmons ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
This species differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
Bird Pokmon are its main prey. This Pokmon knows its weak, so it hunts with a partner.
The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokmon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
This Pokmon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
The ecology and other data about this Pokmon are unknown. It was named Koraidon by the professor who discovered it.
Its characteristics match those of a mysterious object recorded in an old expedition journal as the Iron Serpent.
It sprinkles some of its powdery body onto food and drains the life-force from those who so much as lick it.
It lives inside a superb teacup that was crafted by a potter of great renown. Collectors positively adore this Pokmon.
This form excels in both attack and defense. It ceaselessly unleashes moves like a spring gushes water.
This form is the most aggressive, bombarding enemies with the intensity of flames blazing within a hearth.
This form has excellent defenses, absorbing impacts solidly like the cornerstones that support houses.
Upon sensing danger, it prepares itself for battle by creating a sturdy shell of crystallized Terastal energy.
In this form, Terapagos resembles the world as the ancients saw it, and its Terastal energy is abnormally amplified.
It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As its body grows larger, the seed does too.
The bulb on its back grows as it absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off a pleasant aroma when it blooms.
By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the suns rays, it fills its body with power.
If Charmander is healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously and wont go out even if it gets a bit wet.
It is very hotheaded by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents to battle against. Its aggression will not be quelled if it doesnt win.
It uses its wings to fly sky-high. The more experience it gains in battle, the greater the temperature at which its flames burn.
Its shell is soft immediately after it is born. In no time at all, the shell becomes so resilient that a prodding finger will bounce right off it.
It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. While swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
It has jet nozzles on its shell. This impressive Pokmon uses these jets to charge toward foes with all the force of a rocket.
A very common sight in grasslands and such. It flicks its tongue in and out to sense danger in its surroundings.
This Pokmon is very tenacious. Once it targets its prey, it wont give up the chase, no matter how far the prey goes.
When several of these Pokmon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
No matter how high a place it falls from, this Pokmon can save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.
It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it cant stop touching it.
When it is woken by moonlight, it wanders about. But during the day, it stays still underground.
It secretes a sticky, drool-like nectar. Though sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
It fiendishly scatters allergenic pollen from its petals, which are the largest in the world.
Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.
It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow- moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.
Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Pok Ball.
Its very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it cant help but grovel before it.
Its legs are newly grown, and it cant walk very well. It seems to prefer swimming through the water instead.
Its skin is moist all over its body. The skin on its belly spiral also feels smooth.
It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
It plants its feet deep underground to rehydrate itself. While doing so, its unable to run away if its attacked.
The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
After dissolving many prey, this Pokmons acid becomes sweeter. This makes it even easier to attract more prey.
Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
Moss-covered rocks are Gravelers favorite food. It consumes over a ton of them a day, crunching loudly while it eats.
It deliberately blows itself up, then uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokmon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.
Theyre formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Its heads never sleep at the same timeeach one takes a turn keeping watch while the other sleeps, switching every hour or so.
The strongest head with the thickest neck becomes the leader and gains primary control of the body.
The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
It stores thermal energy in its body to fend off the cold. It swims at eight knots even in frigid waters.
When two of these Pokmons bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
Its so stinky! Muks body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
When attacked, it launches its spikes in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
Hiding in peoples shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
Its usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pok Ball, it has zapped many people.
It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of the Bomb Ball.
Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.
It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
It has complete control over the ligaments in its legs, expanding and contracting them to double the reach of its kicks.
Its fists are masses of muscle. It takes a break every three minutes to steady its breath and mood.
The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air. Thats why its always slightly airborne.
When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
Once it starts running, it wont stopeven if it crashes through boulders. This disposition is whats caused its habitat to expand.
It evolved to walk using only its hind legs, which has allowed it to expand its habitat even onto steep mountains.
It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
Its fin tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
Wavering flames similar to those of the sun appear on the surface of this Pokmons body.
They fight each other by locking horns. The herds protectors take pride in their battle-scarred horns.
In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it cant be seen when it melts away into water.
If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
Porygon is an artificial Pokmon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely through cyberspace.
Its stomachs digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesnt bother it at all.
It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
It is called the divine Pokmon. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature of the area around it.
The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.
Meganiums breath holds within it the power to revive grasses and plants that have withered.
The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
The fur covering this Pokmons body never burns, no matter what. It can shrug off any kind of fire attack.
If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.
It opens its huge jaws wide to attack. If it loses fangs while biting, theyll just keep on growing back, one after another.
Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on land.
If it encounters a foe, it will stand up on its tail, making itself look bigger than usual to intimidate them.
It is nimble and has a very flexible body. Even if you get ahold of it, itll slip right out of your arms.
Since it tells time precisely, some countries consider it to be a deity of wisdom, versed in the ways of the world.
Its extremely soft wings make no sound in flight. It silently sneaks up on prey without being detected.
Some fishers weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokmon.
It wanders in search of food after darkness falls, never nesting in a specific place.
It shoots positively and negatively charged electricity from the tips of its two antennae and stuns its opponents.
It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokmon swallows it in a single gulp.
Despite this Pokmons cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
Since it is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies, its said to come here by riding on a star.
It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the oceans surface.
After it grows up, it leaves the forest it was born in to form groups with other Bellossom. It breaks into dance when it gets excited.
The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so its fine even in rivers with strong currents.
By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
Its the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found practically everywhere. This is because the wind carries this species all over the world.
When the weather grows cold, Skiplooms flower closes and the Pokmon cannot photosynthesize, so it flies away to warmer regions.
Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, youll be racked with coughs and itchiness.
Its tail moves with greater dexterity than its hands. Making deft use of this tail, Aipom lives high among the treetops.
It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
It can see in all directions without moving its big eyes, helping it spot both attackers and prey right away.
When it walks around on land, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on riverbed boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemys actions.
When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
It loves to bite and yank peoples hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
Girafarigs tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokmon from behind.
It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.
Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokmon tends to sleep half the day.
It can make most any Pokmon run away by opening its big mouth to reveal its thick fangs.
Experienced fishers say they try to catch Qwilfish in the brief moment that these Pokmon become defenseless just after launching poisonous spikes.
It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
This is a smart and sneaky Pokmon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.
Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon have a smile back on its face.
It is quite skilled at climbing trees. If it comes across a Primeape while searching for berries in the treetops, trouble will surely ensue.
Its said that in ancient times, when volcanoes were more active, there were many more Slugma than there are now.
According to folklore, a sudden increase in the wild Magcargo population heralds a volcanic eruption.
It rubs its snout against the ground, digging through the soil as it searches for food. Sometimes it digs up hot springs.
Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.
Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.
It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokmon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
This Pokmon is said to sleep at the bottom of the seadeeper than any other life-form can descendbuilding its energy.
It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.
Donphan is normally a calm Pokmon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.
Porygon was upgraded to become capable of planetary development. However, this upgraded version cannot even fly yet.
Its said that this Pokmon used to be stronger long ago when it had many enemies, and that it was even able to evolve under its own power.
The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from the tip of the tail is predetermined for each Smeargle.
Its intense desire to become stronger and stronger drives it to recklessly train its body and challenge any opponent it can find to battle.
It spins on its horn while dealing out elegant kicks. Its horn grows continuously through its lifetime.
It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.
Magma-like blood circulates throughout this Pokmons body, raising its body temperature as high as 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.
It is born deep underground. It cant emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.
Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
Treecko can quickly scale even vertical surfaces. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next days weather.

In its belly, it has a sac filled with burning fire, meaning that Torchic feels as warm as a hot-water bottle if you hug it.
When it enters battle, the flame inside its body burns stronger. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
It can jump powerfully, clearing a 30-story building in a single leap. Its flaming punches scorch its opponents.
When it uses its large tail fin, it picks up speed rapidly in the water. It is strong in spite of its small size.
It is at its best when on muddy ground that offers poor footing. It quickly overwhelms opponents that are bogged down and unable to move.
Swamperts arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down Swamperts foes. This Pokmon makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
Poochyena pursue their prey in packs. Once the prey is exhausted, the pack finishes it off. But sometimes the prey retaliates, and the pack flees.
Once its caught the scent of faraway prey, the leader gives a signal, and the whole pack moves out.
Lotad will gather in lakes that have good water quality. The surfaces of these lakes sometimes become covered in Lotad leaves.
It prefers waterfronts with plentiful food. It became nocturnal so it wouldnt have to compete for food with bird Pokmon.
Dancing with an upbeat rhythm energizes and emboldens it, letting it face any foe without fear.
Seedot live in trees, hanging from the branches and leeching moisture. Rows of them can be found dangling from large, young trees.
Its sensory functions are concentrated in its pointed nose, which it uses to sense its surroundings. The nose is also its weak point.
Legends tell of a bird Pokmon that received divine punishment for its evil deeds and had its beak and wings replaced.
It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokmon. It hides if it senses hostility.
The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.
It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
It is always hungry because it wont stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it cant keep still.
This Pokmon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.
When endangered, it may protect itself by increasing its magnetism and drawing nearby iron objects to its body.
Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.
It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.
It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.
This Pokmon absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out the electricity stored inside its body to create noises.
Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
It flashes the light on its rear to communicate with other Volbeat. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
It guides Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. There are scholars who research the meaning of these signs.
It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.
The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.
Coal is the source of Torkoals energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.
It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes minds.
As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.

The sound of its wings flapping resembles singing. Those entranced by this sound get lured into a sandstorm and become Flygons prey.
It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the deserts heat.
It cant relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.
If it comes across a Seviper, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.
Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. Its Zangooses archrival.
It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
It can live in impure water, where it doesnt need to compete with other water Pokmon for food, so its numbers have steadily increased.
A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
It is the shabbiest Pokmon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.
It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes peoples minds and hearts.
It feeds on the dark emotions of sadness and hatred, which make it grow steadily stronger.
Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokmon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.
Duskulls victims suffer an intense chill as the Pokmon siphons their life-force away, glaring at them with its bright red eye all the while.
Dusclopss true form is said to be a bright red eye burning within its body, but no one has ever seen such a thing.
Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.
Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
It is said that a home visited by a Snorunt will prosper. It can withstand cold of ?150 degrees Fahrenheit.
It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.
Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.
All its cells are magnets. It communicates with others of its kind by transmitting magnetic forces from its body.
It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and large body. Then Metagross uses the mouth on its stomach to chew its prey to bits.
It uses its whole body to photosynthesize when exposed to sunlight. Its shell is made from hardened soil.
It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokmon there on its back.
Some Pokmon are born on a Torterras back and spend their entire life there.
The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means it holds a higher rank in its troop.
It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
It doesnt like to be taken care of. Its difficult to bond with since it wont listen to its Trainer.
Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will mercilessly decimate anything that threatens the safety of its colony.
Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokmon.
The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when its in trouble.
By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
Luxrays ability to see through objects comes in handy when its scouting for danger.
Cranidos toughen up their already sturdy heads by headbutting one another.
If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
This Pokmon lived in primeval jungles. Its thought that Shieldon had few enemies thanks to its sturdy face.
Bastiodon live in herds. When assaulted by enemies, they line up side by side and use their hard faces to block attacks.
The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers nectar from flowers to please Vespiquen.
It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.
A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.
It oozes a purple fluid to deter enemies. Apparently, there are more West Sea Shellos now than there were in the past.

Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a signpost for wandering spirits.
They carry people and Pokmon, but the wind can catch them, so there cant be a fixed destination.
Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
A single cry from this nocturnal Pokmon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
It emits high-frequency cries that people cant hear. Once it starts, it can cry for an awfully long time.
The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.
It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.
They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.
It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. Its bothered by how curly its hair looks.
It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
When it is voraciously gulping down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions, such as joy and rage, in the form of waves.
A well-trained one can use its aura to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.
It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

A Rhyperiors brain is smaller than a Rhydons, but the Rhyperior is stronger because it spends more energy on battling and less on brainpower.

They dwell in volcanic craters. Its said that only a single pair of Magmortar will inhabit any given volcano.
Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
It flies soundlessly through the sky. It catches prey with its long tail, then lunges at the preys vulnerable spots with its fangs.
A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up, to much amazement.
Its programming was modified to enable it to operate in other dimensions. This did not work as planned.
Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while its around.
It comes and goes between this world and the afterlife. People fear this Pokmon because it is said to suck in lost spirits and take them along.
It freezes prey by blowing its ?58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
Research continues on this Pokmon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
It prefers to avoid groups. In its day-to-day life, it dexterously controls its vines to compensate for its short arms.
Servines one weakness is its inflated sense of pride. It takes a while for Servine to be able to cooperate with other Pokmon.
An intimidating gaze and majestic appearance have caused this Pokmon to be known as the Lord of the Forest.
This Pokmon is a ravenous glutton. It uses its excellent sense of smell to find food, then cooks it to a crisp before eating.
When defending its friends, Pignite will stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong. But its powerless when faced with an empty stomach.
The direr the situation, the more it seems to enjoy itself. The flames around its neck intensify, too, increasing Emboars power and speed.
Its said that Oshawott learned to maintain its scalchop with riverbed stones by mimicking humans it saw using whetstones.
Dewott has a studious and stern personality. It masters the use of its scalchops through dedicated, repeated training.
Samurott leads its group strictly. Those who do not follow its rules receive a merciless thrashing.
This Pokmon prefers places with lots of lightning strikes. It catches lightning with its mane and stores the electricity within its body.
