It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
Its drill, which has evolved into steel, is strong enough to bore through iron plates. This Pokmon is a great help in tunnel construction.
It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.
This Pokmon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
Rather than rely on their strength, they master moves that make good use of centrifugal force to swing around concrete.
The bumps on their heads are sensory organs. When Sewaddle meet, they greet each other by rubbing these bumps together.
Swadloon wraps itself in leaves for protection. It uses the two leaves atop its head to detect air movements and feel out its surroundings.
It fashions clothing from woven leaves. Though gentle in disposition, it will show no mercy to foes who target young Pokmon.
When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
It rides on the wind and slips into peoples homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokmon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
Its so vicious that its called the Thug of the River. Yet Basculin is still targeted by predators, such as Dondozo and Bombirdier.
They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
It will abruptly headbutt anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is extremely hard.
This Pokmon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokmon.
Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
These Pokmon like things neat and tidy. They are always sweeping and dusting their habitat, using their tails as brooms.
The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.
Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokmon came from outer space.
It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.
They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokmon exhibit their maximum power.
When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
It strengthens its body by diving into the depths of ponds, swimming around while looking for bog moss to eat.
Its said that many artists have taken inspiration from the sight of a Swanna performing a beautiful dance in the light of dawn.
Despite Deerlings adorable appearance, farmers consider it a nuisance since it loves plant shoots and will eat them all up.
There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.
This Pokmon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.
Amoonguss mimics Pok Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokmon.
They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokmon gather in the area around Alomomola.
Since it cant generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokmon and absorbs static electricity.
When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
These Pokmon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.
These Pokmon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life-force of any who follow it.
The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
It absorbs spirits, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.
Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portionsone to eat now and one to save for later.
It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.
When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, youll get frostbite.
Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.
Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.
They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.
Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
Golurk were created by ancient people to protect both people and Pokmon. They run on a mysterious energy.
Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.
Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
With its sharp claws, this Pokmon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, its a carnivore at heart.
For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.
Watching from the sky, they attack weakened prey on the ground. They have a habit of decorating themselves with bones.
It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
Its said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.
In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.
This Pokmon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heatits in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.
Eating lots of berries makes the bark shell that covers Chespins head and body grow sturdier.
It can send a trailer flying with a tackle. Its numb to pain, so even violent collisions dont faze it.
Its gentle disposition would have it avoid conflict, but it gives opponents a thrashing with its thorned fists when the situation calls for it.
Twigs make for Fennekins snacks. When it nibbles on twigs, it finds the courage to face strong foes.
Braixens branch ignites as its pulled from the Pokmons tail. Braixen then uses the flame to spark powerful attacks.
It controls flames telekinetically, trapping its foes in a fiery vortex surpassing 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit and burning them to a crisp.
It utilizes its extraordinary jumping abilities to flummox its foes, throwing springy bubbles at them from above their heads.
The tips of its fingers and toes stick firmly to vertical surfaces. Frogadier can scale skyscrapers with ease.
It makes shuriken out of mucus excreted from its thighs. These shuriken can cut cleanly through steel cables.
Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.
Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokmon should enter, it will show them no mercy.
When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.
This Pokmon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.
Spewpa doesnt live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.
This Pokmon was born in frigid lands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.
The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.
This Flabb rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokmon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.
This Pokmon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.
They say that flower gardens created by Florges are constantly showered with a power that can heal both body and spirit.
As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.
These Pokmon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.
Behind an Espurrs expressionless face is a frantic struggle to contain psychic power.
If Meowstic continuously emits its powerful psychic energy, it will damage its own body.
Being upside-down improves its blood flow and clears its mind, causing the power of its psychic moves to increase dramatically.
It flashes the luminescent spots on its body to hypnotize its opponents, gaining total control over them.
This Pokmon is a poor swimmer. If its caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.
Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.
Claunchers claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesnt appeal to all tastes.
The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.
Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents weak spots.
Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.
Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.
Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
Goomys horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomys senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.
When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated itll dissolve anything.
This Pokmon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.
In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.
This Pokmon came to be when the spirit of a deceased child possessed a tree stump. It now wanders the forest searching for friends.
Trevenant is very kind to Pokmon living in the forest. It doesnt even care if these Pokmon take up residence in the greenery on its head.
Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of ?148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.
This Pokmon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When its floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.
Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.
In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokmon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.
It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to nestle into its Trainers bag or the front of their jacket.
It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
It nocks its arrow quills and looses them at opponents. When it needs to hit, it pulls the vines on its hood to narrow its view and focus.
While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once theyve grown close, but its a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokmon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.
After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try to help.
Also known as a songstress, it is a sight to behold on moonlit nights when it sings in front of the colony it leads.
Pikipek has strong muscles in its neck, so it wont hurt itself even if it violently shakes its head.
When it encounters foes, it launches the many seeds stored in its beak in a radial burst.
Pairs of Toucannon are considered symbols of companionship, as these Pokmon will raise the temperature of their beaks to warm each other.
It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.
Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesnt seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.
It spits sticky threads and winds them around branches, then swings nimbly from tree to tree in a pendulum-like motion.
As it digests fallen leaves, it generates and stores electricity, which it can discharge from the tips of its jaws.
When carrying a Charjabug, Vikavolt can receive electricity from it and then rapidly fire powerful electromagnetic beams from its large jaws.
If it loses its pincers, theyll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.
Though its punches are powerful, this Pokmons movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.
This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.
Cutiefly sucks up pollen and nectar with its long proboscis. It stores any pollen it doesnt finish eating in its fur.
Pollen puffs created by skilled Ribombee can relieve fatigue, making the puffs a popular commodity.
This Pokmon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.
It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.
It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavortheyre not suitable as food.
Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.
Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesnt change even when its loaded with 50 times its own body weight.
Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.
It supports the water bubble that envelops its head with three of its legs. Sometimes it secretly swaps which legs are holding up the bubble.
It launches sticky water bubbles. Foes who lose consciousness while trapped inside these bubbles will get torn apart by Araquanids gnashing jaws.
Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.
A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokmon puts its Trainers attentiveness to the test.
Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.
When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each others group.
A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokmon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.
Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.
This Pokmon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.
It prefers areas with lots of flowers. A Comfey adorned with flowers is a happy Comfey, and the flowers gain healing effects.
This Pokmon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.
The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.
It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while theyre blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.
From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.
It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komalas drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.
Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokmon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.
When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.
They communicate with their allies using the sounds their scales make when struck. A group of these Pokmon causes quite a racket.
It fires itself up by striking its scales with force as it dances. Its roar is a battle cry.
It bashes its scales to test its opponents mettle. The sound of struck Kommo-o scales frightens weaker foes and sends them running.
As Grookey strikes everything in sight with its stick, it has more and more fun, and its rhythm becomes livelier.
It becomes intensely focused while it drums out vigorous beatsso much so that sometimes it wont listen to its Trainers commands.
When one Rillaboom challenges another who leads a troop, a drumming battle commences. The victor becomes the troops new boss.
Fire energy gathers in the pads of its feet, raising their temperature. Once hot, Scorbunnys footpads can deal heavy damage to opponents.
While it prides itself on its varied kicking moves, it can also deliver powerful headbutts once its flames have heated up its forehead.
Using a ball that it made out of flames, Cinderace blinds its opponents and keeps them at bay.
Its a very cautious Pokmon. When it has no choice but to battle, it hides itself before attacking.
Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it defends its home by laying traps.
It may present itself as being well-mannered, but deep down, it still has a lazy side. It will slack off when its Trainer isnt looking.
No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.
This Pokmon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.
The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidees wings, itll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.
This intelligent Pokmon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.
Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokmon flies through the skies with ease.
A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.
Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.
Chunks of the surface of this Pokmons body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.
Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkols back never falls apart, even when the Pokmon rolls around at high speeds.
Its gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.
Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokmon grows weak.
It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.
When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletuns back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.
Silicobras large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokmon is not very good at telling apart different smells.
The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandacondas saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.
Its an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.
It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokudas eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.
It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.
This selfish, attention-seeking Pokmon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.
The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.
Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.
These Pokmon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.
It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.
The moment this Pokmon finds someone whos emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.
Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterenes territory.
They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.
This Pokmon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. Its popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.
It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasnt given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.
When attacked, it tackles its foe and covers them in cream. With its foe either blinded or astonished by deliciousness, Milcery flees.
Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.
The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when its time to change formation.
This Pokmon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.
Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.
It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.
This Pokmon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.
If you lick the ice covering its face, youll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.
This Pokmon never leaves its Trainers side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.
It has a small stomach. If it isnt constantly eating the seeds it keeps in its pockets, it will get hungry immediately.
Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokmon feed.
Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokmon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.
Its metal body is durable but prone to retaining heat. It vents this heat from the slits in its tail.
It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesnt feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.
This Pokmon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until theyre all grown up.
The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.
The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokmon is in the sun.
The hardness of Floragatos fur depends on the Pokmons mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.
With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize whats going on.
Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecocos head and flickers to and fro.
The valve in Crocalors flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokmon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.
Skeledirges gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.
Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokmon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.
Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokmon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.
This Pokmon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokmon detest.
It entrances female Pokmon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.
The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the threads strength is the topic of ongoing research.
Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.
Its highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.
It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it cant stay in this mode for long.
The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.
Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.
Pawmots fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.
The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.
The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
The yeast in Fidoughs breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokmon has been protected by people since long ago.
The surface of this Pokmons skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.
This Pokmon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.
It basks in the sun to its hearts content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.
This Pokmon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When theyre out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.
The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Naclis body.
It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.
Many Pokmon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.
Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.
This Pokmon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.
An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokmons evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.
It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.
What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolts belly-button dynamo.
These Pokmon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and theyre a popular delicacy.
It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. Theres hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.
Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.
Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.
To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.
Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.
Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.
Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokmon will bury an entire town.
Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.
It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.
This Pokmon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.
Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.
The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.
An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.
It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.
It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.
This Pokmon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until its satisfied with the result.
These Pokmon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each others hammers by smashing them together.
The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.
Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.
A variety of fish Pokmon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.
Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.
Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.
Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizens, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
The steel section is Varooms actual body. This Pokmon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.
Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.
It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The riders body heat warms Cyclizars back and lifts the Pokmons spirit.
This Pokmon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.
Glimmets toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokmon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
Glimmoras petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
This friendly Pokmon doesnt like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.
A lovingly mourned Pokmon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesnt like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.
Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as synchronizing, an entire flock of these Pokmon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.
It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.
Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.
Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.
Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokmon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.
It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.
The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.
It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.
Though it commands a massive army in battle, its not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
This creature resembles a mysterious Pokmon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.
It resembles a mysterious Pokmon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokmon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
This Pokmon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
Sightings of this Pokmon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.
It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokmon.
This Pokmon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
Its possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokmon.
No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokmons traits match up with an object described in an old book.
Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
This Pokmon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.
It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibaxs strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.
It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.
It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes its actually a Pokmon.
It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.
It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.
The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokmon.
It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokmon.
According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokmon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
Its possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
This Pokmon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.
According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.
The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokmon are entirely unrelated.
It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.
Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.
Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.
Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokmon.
This mischief-loving Pokmon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.
It digs holes on mountains, searching for food. Its so durable that being caught in a cave-in wont faze it.
These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.
It resembles an eerie Pokmon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokmon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.
It bears resemblance to a Pokmon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.
It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
Its thought that this Pokmon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokmon.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across many different regions.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Hoenn region.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Sinnoh region.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Unova region.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Kalos region.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Alola region.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed as the two overcame many hardships together.
This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the world.
An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.
A long, long time ago, it lived in the desert. With its sharp claws fully extended, it can run right up an iceberg without slipping.
In hot weather, this Pokmon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.
Its golden whiskers function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so its not very fast, but it has the power to dig through even the hardest bedrock.
If you step on a Geodude sleeping on the ground, youll hear a zapping sound and feel a tingling shock throughout your entire body.
Gravelers entire body is electrically charged due to the stones it likes to eat. It is a very quick-tempered Pokmon.
It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isnt fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
It uses its tail to fish, but the scent of the spice emanating from its tail ensures its catches are always lacking.
Shellder bites down hard on Slowbros arm to suck out more poison. This seems to cause itching, so Slowbro occasionally lashes out.
Alolan Grimer will gladly gobble up any kind of trash, making it a widely used and popular Pokmon at garbage disposal facilities.
What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so dont get too close.
As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.
People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.
It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.
Its dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.
It creates potions by mixing toxins with the food its eaten. Not even Slowking itself knows what effects the potions will have.
It absorbs toxins from the food it eats. The distinct purple spikes on its body are evidence of its potent poison.
This Pokmon can often be seen along seashores. Its capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.
Fishers say that they didnt see many of these Pokmon in the past, but this form of Gastrodon is now increasing in number.
This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven. It will sear the surrounding area with its burning heat, then smile in delight.
The model of washing machine that Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued, so these appliances are now traded at high prices.
The special motor within the refrigerator is the key to bringing about Rotoms change in form.
There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.
This Rotom has possessed a lawn mower. It will mow down grass and flowers, then swagger around with pride at its accomplishments.
The power of its jaws is immenseenough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.
Its ecology is starkly different from that of other Basculin, so theories that its a totally different species have gained traction in recent years.
Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.
Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.
This Pokmon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.
This Pokmons leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldeas is especially aromatic.
Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.
Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.
This Pokmon was born in a snowy land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
This Pokmon was born in a land of severe cold. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
This Pokmon was born in a land of vast space. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
This Pokmon was born in a verdant land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
This Pokmon was born in a land with distinct seasons. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
This Pokmon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.

Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.

Alakazam has traded away its muscles, unleashing its true power. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
The volume of this Pokmon's acid has increased due to Mega Evolution, filling its mouth. If it's not careful, the acid will overflow and spill out.

A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokmon.
It can pass through other dimensions and appear anywhere. It caused a stir one time when it stuck just one leg out of a wall.
Its child has grown rapidly, thanks to the energy of Mega Evolution. Mother and child show off their harmonious teamwork in battle.
Its movements have become more humanlike. Whether it's simply trying to communicate or wants to supplant humanity is unclear.
After Mega Evolution, it becomes able to fly. Perhaps because it's so happy, it rarely touches the ground.
It jets water from the orifices on its sides, streaking above the water surface at supersonic speed.
Parts of its body have become stone. Some scholars claim that this is Aerodactyl's true appearance.
Mega Evolution has excessively powered up this Pokmon's feelings of kindness. It finishes off its opponents with mercy in its heart.
Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint 100 meters in two seconds flat!
Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.
This Pokmon can fire a tremendously powerful Solar Beam from its four flowers. Another name for this is Mega Sol Cannon.
With its arms and hoodlike fin, this Pokmon forms a gigantic set of jaws with a bite 10 times as powerful as Mega Feraligatr's actual jaws.
Massive amounts of energy intensely stimulated Ampharos's cells, apparently awakening its long- sleeping dragon's blood.
A combination of toxins and the shock of evolving has increased Shellder's intelligence to the point that Shellder now controls Slowking.
To protect itself from opponents' attacks, it uses magnetism to control pieces of its hard outer shell that have flaked off.

It can grip things with its two horns and lift 500 times its own body weight.
It flies faster than the speed of sound. After whipping up shock waves to send enemies flying, it finishes them off with its talons.

The effects of Mega Evolution make it more ferocious than ever. It's unclear whether it can even hear its Trainer's orders.
When it opens the red plate on its chest and unleashes its heart, its strongest psychic power is released.
The jewel from its chest, which has grown gigantic due to the effects of Mega Evolution, can turn back any attack.
Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.

Thanks to Mega Evolution, its mental power is limitless. It conjures up arms imbued with malice to defeat its enemies.
Mega Evolution fills its body with a tremendous amount of electricity, but it's too much for Manectric to fully control.
The spines sprouting from its head are transformed fangs. If they're injured or broken off, the spines will regenerate countless times.
When this Pokmon's rage reaches a boiling point, the huge volcano in the hump on its back erupts violently, spewing molten lava.
Its down is so soft, it seems as if a touch could melt it. But it's strong enough that just a few strands could be used to hoist a dump truck.
Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
When this Pokmon whips the winglike fur on its back as though beating its wings, it sends an intimidating aura flying at its opponents.
When it spews stupendously cold air from its broken mouth, the entire area around it gets whited out.

This Pokmon spews flames hotter than 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. It swings around its grand, blazing mane as it protects its allies.
This Flabb rides a yellow flower. The Pokmon is defenseless and vulnerable before it has found and received power from a flower.
It receives strength from flowers and gives them some of its energy in return. This Pokmon likes orange flowers best of all.
This Pokmon likes blue flowers best of all. It floats upward using the power emanating from its flower and bobs along lightly through the air.
When evening falls, it searches out a place blooming with flowers of the same white color as its own flower, and then it goes to sleep.
This Pokmon can draw forth the power hidden within yellow flowers. This power then becomes the moves Floette uses to protect itself.
This Pokmon can draw forth the most power when in sync with orange flowers, compared to flowers of other colors.
Whenever this Pokmon finds flowering plants that are withering, it will bring them back to its territory and care for them until they are healthy.
If it finds someone messing up a flower bed, it will attack them without mercy. This Floette takes particularly good care of white flowers.
This rare Floette holds a plant that died out in ancient times. The Pokmon is said to harbor an incredible power.
The Eternal Flower has absorbed all the energy from Mega Evolution. The flower now attacks enemies on its own.
It is said that there was once a Florges that protected the garden of a castle for over 300 years.
When Florges attacks, its orange flowers fire off powerful beams as if they were a battery of artillery.
Blue pigments were tremendously expensive in the past, so paintings of blue Florges are highly valuable.
A flower garden made by a white-flowered Florges will be beautifully decorated with flowering plants of many different colors.
